{{cpp/ranges/chunk_by_view/title|begin}}
{{cpp/ranges/chunk_by_view/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++23|1=
constexpr /*iterator*/ begin();
}}

Returns an {{rlp|iterator}} to the first element of the {{rlpt|/|chunk_by_view}}.

Equivalent to:
{{source|1=
ranges::iterator_t&lt;V&gt; iter;

if (begin_.has_value())
    iter = begin_.value();
else
{
    iter = /*find_next*/(ranges::begin(base()));
    begin_ = iter; // caching
}

return /*iterator*/(*this, ranges::begin(base()), iter);
}}

The behavior is undefined if the underlying predicate {{rlpsi|/#pred_}} does not contain a value.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{rlp|iterator|Iterator}} to the first element.

===Notes===
In order to provide the amortized constant-time complexity required by the {{lconcept|range}} concept, this function caches the result within the data member {{rlpsi|/#begin_}} for use on subsequent calls.
